meanings.definition: A person or thing that disrupts or causes disturbance.
meanings.sent1: The loud disruptor in the classroom made it hard to focus on the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The construction noise outside was a disruptor to the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was a disruptor during the serious meeting, bringing smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter acted as a disruptor, breaking the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected fire alarm was a disruptor, causing chaos and confusion among the students.

meanings.definition: Something that interrupts the normal course or unity of something.
meanings.sent1: The power outage was a disruptor to the smooth running of the factory.
meanings.sent2: The sudden rainstorm was a disruptor to our picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became a disruptor when it stole all the birdseed from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: The new technology became a disruptor in the market, changing the way people interact with each other.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam was a disruptor to our journey, causing delays and frustration.
